document.body:

FAQ Login
What are some healthy foods I can take to work if I'm on a diet? Trying to figure out how to shed some pounds? Share your success stories, and discuss all weight loss questions here. Post a reply 6 posts•Page 1 of 1
What are some healthy foods I can take to work if I'm on a diet?
by hjortur100 »Wed Dec 08, 2010 5:17 am I'm tired of eating the same thing day after day and end up finding myself eating the junk they have at work. I'm hoping you guys can give me some inexpensive ideas for healthy foods/snacks to take to work. I have lost 34 pounds and don't want working again to stop the weight loss. And, we don't have a fridge, so everything goes into my cooler. What is Unique Hoodia hjortur100 Posts: 0 Joined: Wed Dec 08, 2010 3:27 am Top
What are some healthy foods I can take to work if I'm on a diet?
by ferehar »Wed Dec 08, 2010 5:30 am The easiest I've found is fruit and yogurt. Veggies if you like them. They're all small, great snacks you can buy in bulk and cut up and bring what you need. arthritis forum ferehar Posts: 0 Joined: Tue Nov 23, 2010 3:16 pm Top
What are some healthy foods I can take to work if I'm on a diet?
by shayan14 »Wed Dec 08, 2010 5:38 am i make sure to keep a few different options. right now i have a pack of 60 calorie string cheese sticks (low fat, high protein), a pack of 90 calorie chewy granola bars (in case i want chocolate), some apples (they take a long time to eat so you get the feeling of eating), a pack of gum (for the feeling of chewing), 80 calorie yogurt (nonfat, high protein) heart diseases forum shayan14 Posts: 0 Joined: Sun Dec 05, 2010 10:29 pm Top
What are some healthy foods I can take to work if I'm on a diet?
by desmond87 »Wed Dec 08, 2010 5:52 am lowfat yogurt, greek yogurt, fresh fruits and veggies. dissociative disorders forum desmond87 Posts: 0 Joined: Mon Jun 07, 2010 5:01 am Top
What are some healthy foods I can take to work if I'm on a diet?
by wellington »Wed Dec 08, 2010 5:53 am -apple - 1/2 cup berries.. (or your choice of fruit servings) -cucumber slices , or baby carrots -mixed nuts (but don't exceed a handful a day) such as almonds or cashews -raisins -low-calorie snack bars: I know kellogs make ones that are only 90 calories each -rice crackers: those are yummy and low in calories -drinks include natural unsweetened juice/water/green tea... anxiety disorders forum wellington Posts: 0 Joined: Mon Nov 22, 2010 5:24 pm Top
What are some healthy foods I can take to work if I'm on a diet?
by ramone70 »Wed Dec 08, 2010 6:08 am I'm right there with ya! I just started a diet 3 months ago and I've lost almost 30 pounds. i'm working out and i feel pretty good but i'm so scared i'm going to fall of the wagon.
I'm trying so hard to avoid food at work. I work at a fast food restaurant an I get the food for free on top of it. so it's incredibly hard to say no, but i'm doing well so far. i refused to eat that stuff and only bring in my own. I also have to keep my food out, so I can sympathize.
I can only offer what I've done myself, and I'm not sure what your tastes are. keep in mind that i save my healthy, energy and fulfilling eating for home. at work, it's all about trying to make it through the next minute.
- I generally bring in various cut fruit, like watermelon, cantaloupe and apples (lots of it! in order to avoid temptation, i often bring in way more than i even really want to eat, forcing myself to eat as much as possible so that i have no desire for anything else. now that i've broken my bad habits, i've been able to bring in less and less). i cut them in bite size chunks and i find they stay well even out of the fridge for a few hours. it's a light but filling meal. I do this 2-3 days a week. The added benefit is that it's easy to grab an go and you can mix up all your fruit each day. prepare it the night before and it's even easier to avoid excuses.
- It might sound weird, but I love fat free croutons. There are tons of them in your grocery store that you can choose from. I usually buy a couple of bags of fat free, low cal croutons of various flavors- rothsbury farms brand. I put a big helping into a baggie and eat them like chips (p.s.- their plain versions are great with fat free yogurt as a dip!). I know it's weird but I've kind of had to get creative. I was getting sick of salads every day, dammit! the croutons give me that'snacking'feeling while also filling me up when i bring in the yogurt. it's helps with my boredom binging.
- i've been playing around with salads lately. i try to step out of that standard green salad box. there are tons of things you can do. sometimes, i just buy different types of colored tomatoes and cut them up in a bowl with some chopped scallions on them. throw some yogurt dressing or low cal italian on there and you've got a great, quick work meal. i also tried mixing strange veggies that i've never had before. i once made an entire salad out of veggies i'd never had. i also mixed different colored bell peppers cut in different ways with some cucumbers and just a splash of apple cider vinegar and it was yummy. find a veggie you really like and try to find different versions of it. mix it all together.
- someone once told me that you can get the same amount of energy by eating an apple in the morning as you would drinking a cup of coffee/soda. so i make salads out of 4 different types of apples, diced really small, with a very light, low fat whipped cream mixed through. not a lot, though, because i'm trying to stay away from even'low fat'versions of the food i used to eat before. i'm trying to change my life, not just'diet'. but it's a healthier version of a parfait that still fills you up and gives you a little sweetness.
- mix up your meals. don't be afraid to eat breakfast stuff in the afternoon and vice-versa. try some special k cereal with some walnuts, strawberries and bananas on it. use 2% milk in a carton. it should stay fine in your cooler until you go on break. even if it's at night, sometimes this stuff really hits the spot. bring enough for 2 bowls worth if you don't think it will fill you up.
keep in mind i always made *large* helpings- i'm not trying to starve myself. i often brought home or threw away a bit. it's better now that i'm over that initial diet phase, but i still bring it a bit more than i normally want. even if i throw a tad away, it's worth it if i avoid eating something that will undo all the good work i'm doing. or if i end up starving on my way home and stop and get something.
hope some of these idea help! good luck! Pure Hoodia Gordonii ramone70 Posts: 0 Joined: Thu Feb 11, 2010 10:02 am Top Display posts from previous: All posts 1 day 7 days 2 weeks 1 month 3 months 6 months 1 year Sort by Author Post time Subject Ascending Descending Post a reply 6 posts•Page 1 of 1
